thread.section_title: Reuters: Financial Services and Real Estate
thread.title: Regional Fed banks backed holding discount rate steady -minutes

title: Regional Fed banks backed holding discount rate steady -minutes
text:
May 29, 2018 / 6:01 PM / Updated an hour ago Regional Fed banks backed holding discount rate steady: minutes Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - All 12 regional Federal Reserve banks supported holding steady the interest rate commercial banks pay for emergency loans ahead of the central bankâ€™s latest policy meeting, minutes of Fed discount rate discussions showed on Tuesday.
The U.S. central bank held the discount rate at 2-1/4 percent while also holding steady its benchmark lending rate at its May 1-2 meeting.
The Fed last raised interest rates on March 21 and is expected to lift them again in June. Reporting by Jason Lange; Editing by Andrea Ricci
